title: Vedder Mountain
text:
The Vedder Mountain is a branch of the <a href="Cascade%20Range">Cascade Range</a> in the <a href="Pacific%20Northwest">Pacific Northwest</a>, located at the southeastern edge of the <a href="Fraser%20Lowland">Fraser Lowland</a> in <a href="British%20Columbia">British Columbia</a>, <a href="Canada">Canada</a>, between the village of <a href="Yarrow%2C%20British%20Columbia">Yarrow</a> and the village of <a href="Cultus%20Lake%2C%20British%20Columbia">Cultus Lake</a>, extending from the <a href="Vedder%20River">Vedder River</a> to the Saar Creek valley. It separates the broad <a href="Fraser%20Valley">Fraser Valley</a> and <a href="Sumas%20Prairie">Sumas Prairie</a> in its northwest from the narrow <a href="Columbia%20Valley%20%28Lower%20Mainland%29">Columbia Valley</a> to its southeast.
The <a href="mountain">mountain</a> stands high and is tree-covered to its summit with some open areas. A hiking trail crosses the mountain. Old <a href="Gravel%20road%23Logging%20roads">logging roads</a> are also present. Catherwood Logging rail-logged the hill in the 1930s, and both east and west sides were cut with <a href="forest%20railway">rail</a>s coming from <a href="Vedder%20Crossing%2C%20Chilliwack">Vedder Crossing</a>.
